isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: HOLSET SS 296 AND QE 296/338 - TESTING - TESTING FOR LEAKAGE

svcproc.title: TESTING FOR LEAKAGE
svcproc.para: Park the vehicle without a trailer on a level surface and block the wheels to prevent movement and then release the parking brake. Build up air tanks to air governor cut-out pressure; stop engine; let air pressure gauges stabilize for one minute, then time the pressure drop on the gauges. Pressure should not drop more than 2 psi per minute. If the gauges do not drop excessively, then the leakage must be from the wet tank (not indicated on gauge) up stream of the service tanks. This is most easily checked by separating lines at various junctions and applying shop air to the system while feeling and listening for leaks. Soapy water and high frequency acoustic detectors may also be helpful.

If equipped with an air dryer, refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on checking for air leaks for the type of air dryer being serviced. Also refer to TROUBLESHOOTING for other possible causes.
